catalog.name: Unidata THREDDS Data Server - NCEP models

dataset.name: Historical Unidata Internet Data Distribution (IDD) Gridded Model Data (ds335.0)

metadata.documentation: Read by CDM Grib Collection, version 2.

creator.name: National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA)/National Weather Service (NWS) National Center for Environmental Prediction (NCEP)

metadata.documentation: Historical Unidata Internet Data Distribution (IDD) Gridded Model Data are obtained via the Unidata Internet Data Distribution System (IDD). Data includes gridded analyses and forecasts from US National Centers for Environmental Prediction (NCEP) and European Centre for Medium-Range Weather Forecasts (ECMWF) models. Models include NCEP ETA, NAM and RUC covering the Continental US, NCEP Ensemble and GFS covering North America and the globe, and GFS Extended and ECMWF covering the globe, at various spatial and temporal resolutions. Potential variables found in the model output include pressure, relative humidity, temperature, geopotential height, zonal component wind speed, and V-component wind speed. Online archives include 1 year of data, and are populated daily with model output generated two days prior to the current date. Additionally, GFS Global 0.5 degree analysis fields from November 2006 to near the present are available online for web download. Older historical files, beginning in December 2002, are available upon request.
NCEP Global Forecast System Model, previously called AVN/MRF (Medium Range Forecast)

documentation.xlink:title: COMET MetEd (Meteorology Education and Training) documentation

metadata.documentation: NCEP GFS Model : AWIPS 230 (G) Grid. Global 361 by 720 Lat/Lon grid. GFS 0.5deg global analysis data is available at 00Z, 06Z, 12Z, and 18Z. Vertical levels include surface and pressure levels from 1000 mb to 10 mb.

NCEP GFS Model : AWIPS 228 (A) Grid. Global 181 by 360 Lat/Lon grid. GFS1p0 model data is available at 00Z, 06Z, 12Z, and 18Z with analysis and forecasts every 3 hours out to 192 hours (8 days). Forecast variables are available at 3 hour intervals. Vertical levels include surface and mandatory pressure levels from 1000 mb to 100 mb.

NCEP GFS Model : AWIPS 228 (A) Grid. Global 73 by 144 Lat/Lon grid. GFS2p5 model data is available at 00Z, 06Z, 12Z, and 18Z with forecasts from 192 to 384 hours included in each file. Forecast variables aat 12 hour intervals from 192 to 384 hours. Vertical levels include surface and mandatory pressure levels from 1000 mb to 100 mb.
North American Model (NAM). NCEP Nonhydrostatic Mesoscale Model (NMM) and Gridpoint Statistical Interpolation (GSI) analysis, running in the Weather Research and Forecasting (WRF) infrastructure.

documentation.xlink:title: COMET MetEd (Meteorology Education and Training) documentation

metadata.documentation: NCEP North American Model : AWIPS 218 (B) grid over the continental United States. Horizontal = 614 by 428 points, resolution 12.19 km, LambertConformal projection. NAM model data is available at 00Z, 06Z, 12Z, and 18Z, with analysis and forecast every 3 hours out to 84 hours. Vertical levels include surface and isobaric levels from 1000 mb to 100 mb in 25 mb increments.

NCEP Rapid Refresh (RR / RAP)) Model: frequently updated short-range weather forecasts. Replaced the Rapid Update Cycle (RUC/RUC2) on 05 May 2012 12Z. Model runs are made hourly, with analysis and hourly forecasts out to 3 hours; on the 0, 3, 6, 9, 12, 15, 18, and 21Z runs, the hourly forecasts go out to 12 hours. Horizontal = 301 by 225 points, resolution 20.31 km, Lambert Conformal projection.
